members.name: ARROW_BUTTON
members.comment: ArrowButton's are special types of buttons that also render a directional indicator, typically an arrow. ArrowButtons are used by composite components, for example ScrollBar's contain ArrowButtons. To bind a style to this Region use the name ArrowButton.

members.name: BUTTON
members.comment: Button region. To bind a style to this Region use the name Button.

members.comment: CheckBox region. To bind a style to this Region use the name CheckBox.

members.name: INTERNAL_FRAME_TITLE_PANE
members.comment: TitlePane of an InternalFrame. The TitlePane typically shows a menu, title, widgets to manipulate the internal frame. To bind a style to this Region use the name InternalFrameTitlePane.

members.comment: Accelerator region of a MenuItem. To bind a style to this Region use the name MenuItemAccelerator.

members.name: SCROLL_BAR
members.comment: ScrollBar region. To bind a style to this Region use the name ScrollBar.

members.name: SCROLL_BAR_TRACK
members.comment: Track of the ScrollBar. To bind a style to this Region use the name ScrollBarTrack.

members.name: SCROLL_BAR_THUMB
members.comment: Thumb of the ScrollBar. The thumb is the region of the ScrollBar that gives a graphical depiction of what percentage of the View is currently visible. To bind a style to this Region use the name ScrollBarThumb.

members.name: SCROLL_PANE
members.comment: ScrollPane region. To bind a style to this Region use the name ScrollPane.

members.name: SEPARATOR
members.comment: Separator region. To bind a style to this Region use the name Separator.

members.name: SLIDER
members.comment: Slider region. To bind a style to this Region use the name Slider.

members.name: SLIDER_TRACK
members.comment: Track of the Slider. To bind a style to this Region use the name SliderTrack.

members.name: SLIDER_THUMB
members.comment: Thumb of the Slider. The thumb of the Slider identifies the current value. To bind a style to this Region use the name SliderThumb.

members.name: SPINNER
members.comment: Spinner region. To bind a style to this Region use the name Spinner.

members.name: SPLIT_PANE

members.comment: Region of a TabbedPane for one tab. To bind a style to this Region use the name TabbedPaneTab.

members.comment: Region of a TabbedPane containing the tabs. To bind a style to this Region use the name TabbedPaneTabArea.

members.name: TABBED_PANE_CONTENT
members.comment: Region of a TabbedPane containing the content. To bind a style to this Region use the name TabbedPaneContent.

members.comment: Region for the Window containing the ToolBar. To bind a style to this Region use the name ToolBarDragWindow.

members.comment: ToolTip region. To bind a style to this Region use the name ToolTip.

members.comment: ToolBar separator region. To bind a style to this Region use the name ToolBarSeparator.

members.name: TREE
members.comment: Tree region. To bind a style to this Region use the name Tree.

members.comment: Region of the Tree for one cell. To bind a style to this Region use the name TreeCell.

members.name: VIEWPORT
members.comment: Viewport region. To bind a style to this Region use the name Viewport.

members.name: isSubregion
members.comment: Returns true if the Region is a subregion of a Component, otherwise false. For example, Region.BUTTON corresponds do a Component so that Region.BUTTON.isSubregion() returns false.

return: true if the Region is a subregion of a Component.

members.name: getName
members.comment: Returns the name of the region.

members.name: toString
members.comment: Returns the name of the Region.
Creates a Region with the specified name. This should only be used if you are creating your own JComponent subclass with a custom ComponentUI class.

param: ui - String that will be returned from component.getUIClassID. This will be null if this is a subregion.
subregion - Whether or not this is a subregion.

name: javax.swing.plaf.synth.Region
